title: How to get help in the simplest way about eBook and self-publishing - Quora

response.answer_text: You want help, not just a link, so I suggest you look up Kindlepreneur - Book Marketing for Self-Publishing Authors  Dave Chesson offers lots of advice for novices and some free tools to calculate sales rank and do formatted book descriptions. He also has a paid tool for researching on Amazon for keywords, but you probably won’t need that at this stage. My blog also has some advice, such as comparing Adobe InDesign with MS Word to design a book, why use IngramSpark, and so on. I suggest this order for actions. Research which deep niche you’re going to write about, note any gapsDo keyword research and brainstorm titlesWrite the ebookChoose a platform and design the ebook with that portal in mind (e.g. Smashwords has specific instructions for clearing fonts)Remember to plan your marketing for your books, including writing guest articles for great news and feature magazines.

You can write your book then send it to a company “Draft2Digital. You can write your book then send it to a company “Smashwords” You can write your book then send it to a company Amazon Kindle publishing There is also this organization I have not investigated, but you might find helpful.
